main event: An unidentified flying object was reported by three engineers observing a balloon at General Mills in Minneapolis, Minnesota on October 15, 1953.
interesting points: The object was first observed as it passed below the sun at an elevation of approximately 25 degrees,The object accelerated from 5-10 mph to an estimated 1000 mph with a horizontal flight of 10 degrees in 9 seconds,Observers noted that the object performed an unusual vertical dive deemed dangerous,No sound was detected during the observation,Three qualified observers (two engineers and a technician) reported the sighting and found it puzzling due to the object's speed and flight behavior.
witness description: engineers and technicians from General Mills
